title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1023.16 - Approach of emergency vehicles
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1023.16 - Approach of emergency vehicles

State Regulations

Upon the approach of any ambulance, police or fire
department vehicle, or upon the approach of Triborough Bridge and Tunnel

Authority vehicles giving adequate warning by means of bell or warning light, all traffic shall proceed as near as possible to the right-hand curb on the
roadway and stop, unless and until otherwise directed by an employee of the

Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority, properly identified, or a New York City
police officer, or until such traffic shall have passed. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1023.16

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
